item.title: Comet (song)
item.description:
"Comet" is a well-known humorous children's song in parts of North America and other English-speaking countries. It describes the deleterious effects of consuming Comet cleanserâ€”a powdered cleansing product. The most prominent and often-occurring effect in the song is that it turns one's teeth green. Among other effects alleged by this song are an unappealing taste and, unsurprisingly, a tendency to vomit. Although this song, like many in its genre, has widely variable lyrics, a common version contains the following words:
Comet - it makes your teeth [or "lips"] turn green!; Comet - it tastes like gasoline [or "kerosene" in Australia; or "Listerine", in the variation where your lips turn green]!; Comet - it makes you vomit; So buy [or "eat" or "get"] some Comet, and vomit, today! Alternately (rural Oregon circa 1972):
Comet - it makes your heart turn blue, Comet - it tastes like Elmer's Glue, Comet - it makes you vomit, So try Comet, and Vomit, Today! The melody of the song is the "Colonel Bogey March" whistled in the movie 'Bridge Over the River Kwai'.
